snippet: The Security Council called for a bolstered international presence in the East African nation but stopped short of sanctions against those who incite violence.
abstract: United Nations Security Council unanimously passes resolution to strengthen international presence in Burundi, country rocked by violence and edging towards civil war; proposal includes possibility of peacekeeper deployment, and asks for talks between government opponents and Pres Pierre Nkurunziza.
lead_paragraph: The Security Council called for a bolstered international presence in the East African nation but stopped short of sanctions against those who incite violence.

headline.main: U.N. Security Council Seeks to Head Off Mass Atrocities in Burundi
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | United Nations; Council Seeks to Halt Burundi Violence

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
